answers.author: Yana McConaty
answers.text:
Jeffrey, you can forecast your resources by first creating a model that determines the FTE requirement/resource needed to produce each unit of service (based on your current level) and then have the model drive your future requirement based on the increase in the number of service units. This is a simplified activity-based costing exercise of sorts. Alternatively, you can research the staffing levels of the municipality that is similar in size/characteristics of your projected growth.

answers.author: Barbara DeLeon
answers.text:
I would add to Yana's comments above that if you research the staffing levels of other municipalities take care to consider demographics, geographic proximity to other major population centers (for shared services), land area (sq. mi.), centerline miles of streets, services provided, budget size and other key parameters when benchmarking.  Most cities provide an employees per resident statistic in their budget books and I have used that in the past after developing a good comparison group.

answers.author: Sam Anselm
answers.text:
I agree with the suggestions of contacting similar-sized cities, with the caveat that they are likely understaffed as well. I've been reading Ken Miller's books (We Don't Make Widgets; Extreme Government Makeover) and have found that focusing on process improvements will help you gain more efficiency than merely bringing on more people.

author: Jeffrey Trinker
text:
I work for a city that is on the cusp of rapid growth (both residential and commercial).  Management knows that we will need to increase our staff size in order to continue to provide the same level of service, but we do not know how to forecast those future needs in a non-arbitrary fashion (i.e. with data).  We have estimates as to future populations via our comprehensive plan and research collected by the council of governments.
My question is whether or not there are models or "rules of thumb" that can be utilized to help determine future staffing needs in response to population growth?
Thanks in advance for feedback!
title: Model for determining future staffing needs?
